page.title: 14The Green Belt.
page.content: A problem that the children of All Soul's Primary School found was the protection of the {Green Belt} surrounding Heywood. They are situated close to that part which separates Heywood from Rochdale, and they found that the increasing control of the town's affairs, either by Rochdale Metropolitan Borough Council, or Greater Manchester Council, would threaten that area. They conducted a small survey near the school and found that people wanted to preserve the Belt.If it was to be used at all, then it should be for Industry, to create jobs, but not for Housing. They visited {Farms} in the Belt and found that farmers wanted to keep the land for agricultural use and that they were not prepared to sell it. This whole situation may change after the abolition of G.M.C. in 1986.
